text: this sensational make-ahead frozen
dessert is going to be your go-to for
summer it is made very simply with fruit
and sweet and Greek yogurt so I'm gonna
start with a fruit puree start with 6
ounces of raspberries and 3/4 cup of
sugar and I'm gonna kind of crush it
while it's cooking so that I start those
juices coming out you really have to
stay with this because otherwise the
sugar will burn keep stirring wait until
it boils and all the fruit breaks down
okay
it's boiling and all the juices have
come out so here comes the raspberry and
the color is gorgeous it's really dark
red now and this juice is going to
flavor and sweeten the yogurt all at the
same time so basically I'm making a
raspberry yogurt and this terrine gets
three different layers of three
different fruits and this is where you
can have a lot of fun with it you can
customize whatever fruits you like so
all these seeds come out don't want any
of these seeds in your yogurt but you do
want all that yummy pulp from the
raspberries so to this I'm gonna add one
and a quarter cups of plain Greek yogurt
and this is the low-fat 2% yogurt so I'm
going to whisk together this beautiful
pink concoction here of the yogurt fruit
and sugar this is going to go into the
ice cream machine and it takes about
20-30 minutes for this amount of yogurt
to freeze at least in my machine
and Tapan start okay so now we're on to
the second layer I have the six ounces
of strawberries with 3/4 cup of sugar
I'm gonna cook it just like I did the
raspberries over about medium
medium-high heat
strawberries take a little bit longer
than raspberries because they are a
little bit firmer so this will take a
few more minutes
strawberry is boiling and the fruit is
softened so I'm all set to go I'm going
to do the same thing I did with the
raspberry and then strain this out mix
it with the yogurt and freeze it okay
our raspberry yogurt is done I'm gonna
stop it and I have three little loaf
pans lined with parchment paper I also
have this is my secret ingredient the
whole wheat biscuit crackers and they're
gonna add a little crumb layer in
between the three different fruit
yogurts I'm just going to kind of
eyeball 1/3 1/3 1/3 into the pan and the
parchment just helps to pull it out when
it's done so spread this even we want
nice stripes of the yogurt so we want it
nice and even now I'm going to add the
crumbs these are my cracker cookie
crumbs sprinkle over the top this is
gonna go into the freezer I would say at
least an hour to get nice and firm and
then we're gonna add our strawberry
layer okay for the final layer we're
doing mango layer but same amount of
fruit six ounces of fruit and then 3/4
cup of sugar fruits like this the melons
and the mangos that have a lot of water
content you don't need to cook them just
puree and all those juices will come out
in the ball perfect
all pureed really juicy now we just have
to strain just like the other two this
combines with the same amount of that 2%
Greek yogurt one and a quarter cups get
all the lumps of the yogurt out into the
ice-cream machine with this one so once
this is in cover with plastic wrap leave
it in the freezer at least three hours
or up to three days is the event okay
our yogurt terrines are done they've
been in the freezer for at least three
hours invert onto this little plate look
at how pretty that is
look at those layers oh my gosh so
gorgeous this parchment makes it so easy
take that off now it's ready to slice
love the combination of these flavors
the two berries the raspberries the dark
one the strawberry in the middle and
then the mango is such a great
combination I'm gonna give it a try and
you can see the little cookie crumbs in
there make such a nice pretty dividing
line between all of them
Oh Prudie creamy very little fat
make-ahead pooling so great for summer
